text: Trash isnâ€™t hygienic or safe for the classroom.
Keeping trash outside negatively affects our well-being
A tidy environment ensures good health and well-beingTo maintain good health, we should not keep trash anywhere but in the dustbin.
Tidy up your corner after lunch.
Pick up your trash from the floor.
Sharpen your pencils at the dustbin, not at your desk.
Bring trash-free lunches i.e. neatly packed items that do not have any trash items.
A messy space is not organized so it impacts our thinking ability.
A mess can make others feel upset if they are orderly.
Keeping a space organized creates harmony and positive communication.
Fold your clothes properly after each wash.
Neatly arrange your items in your corner on the desk or the study table.
Stack your plate on the counter after each wash.
Do not leave a mess in the common areas like the living room and the dining room.
